description: The NSQIP_INFO table contains NSQIP registry data for the surgeries that are selected for NSQIP submission.

columns.name: REGISTRY_DATA_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the registry data record.

columns.name: REGISTRY_DATA_NAME
columns.description: The registry record name.

columns.name: RECORD_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the record status (hidden, soft-deleted, etc...).


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Soft Deleted


Hidden


Hidden and Soft Deleted

columns.name: REGISTRY_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the registry associated with this RDI record.

columns.name: REGISTRY_ID_REGISTRY_NAME
columns.description: The name of the registry record.

columns.name: REG_OVRIDE_CONTEXT
columns.description: The override context string to identify the correct override record for the registry settings record (HFR).

columns.name: PAT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the patient associated with this registry record.

columns.name: PAT_DATE
columns.description: The date of patient encounter linked to the surgery.

columns.name: LOG_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the surgery associated with this registry record.

columns.name: NSQIP_CYCLE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the cycle number assigned to the case. A cycle number is assigned to every eight consecutive days in a calendar year. It is automatically generated based on the operation date.

columns.name: NSQIP_IDN
columns.description: The unique identifier for the patient in the ACS NSQIP database.

columns.name: NSQIP_LMRN
columns.description: The Medical Record Number (MRN) of the patient as assigned by the hospital.

columns.name: NSQIP_DOB_DT
columns.description: The patient's date of birth.

columns.name: NSQIP_GENDER_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the gender of the patient.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Male


Female


Non-binary

columns.name: NSQIP_RACE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the race of the patient. Starting with the January 2021 specification updates, discrete race categories are now located in the column NSQIP_RACES.NSQIP_RACES_C.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


White


Black or African American


American Indian or Alaska Native


Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander


Asian


Unknown / Not Reported


Some Other Race

columns.name: NSQIP_HISPANIC_C_NAME
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient is of Hispanic or Latino ethnicity.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes


Unknown

columns.name: NSQIP_NAME_MI
columns.description: The patient's middle initial.

columns.name: NSQIP_NAME_LAST

columns.name: NSQIP_COUNTY
columns.description: The patient's county.

columns.name: NSQIP_HOME_PHONE
columns.description: The patient's home phone number.

columns.name: NSQIP_WORK_PHONE
columns.description: The patient's work phone number.

columns.name: NSQIP_CELL_PHONE
columns.description: The patient's cell phone number.

columns.name: NSQIP_PREF_LANG_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the preferred language of the patient.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


English


Spanish

columns.name: NSQIP_PRIN_PROC_PANEL
columns.description: The panel number corresponding to the NSQIP principal operative procedure. It is used along with procedure ID from NSQIP_PRIN_PROC_ID to identify the row in OR_LOG_ALL_PROC table corresponding to the NSQIP principal operative procedure.

columns.name: NSQIP_PRIN_PROC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the procedure record corresponding to the NSQIP principal operative procedure. It is used along with panel number from NSQIP_PRIN_PROC_PANEL to identify the row in OR_LOG_ALL_PROC table corresponding to the NSQIP principal operative procedure.

columns.name: NSQIP_PRIN_PROC_ID_PROC_NAME
columns.description: The name of the surgical procedure record.

columns.name: NSQIP_PRIN_PROC_CPT
columns.description: The CPT code of the principal NSQIP procedure.

columns.name: NSQIP_PRIN_PROC_NAME
columns.description: The name of the principal operative procedure.

columns.name: NSQIP_ADMSN_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the admission status of the case (inpatient or outpatient).


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Outpatient


Inpatient

columns.name: NSQIP_ELECTIVE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Indicates whether the surgical case is considered an elective case.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No


Unknown

columns.name: NSQIP_ORIGIN_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the origin status of the case. It indicates whether the patient was admitted from their home or from another type of facility.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Admitted directly from home


Acute care hospital


Nursing home / Chronic care / Intermediate care


Transfer from other


Outside emergency department


Unknown


Home/Permanent residence


Acute care hospital


Other facility

columns.name: NSQIP_ADMSN_DT
columns.description: The date the patient was admitted to the hospital for the principal operative procedure.

columns.name: NSQIP_OPERATION_DT
columns.description: The date the patient entered the surgical suite for the principal operative procedure.

columns.name: NSQIP_PRIN_ANES_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the principal anesthesia type of the case.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


General


Epidural


Spinal


Regional


Local


Monitored Anesthesia Care (MAC) / IV Sedation


Other


Unknown


None

columns.name: NSQIP_SPECIALTY_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the surgical specialty of the case.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


General Surgery


Gynecology


Neurosurgery


Orthopedics


Otolaryngology (ENT)


Plastics


Cardiac


Thoracic


Urology


Vascular


Interventional Radiologist


Obstetrics

columns.name: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the surgical case is considered an emergency case.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: NSQIP_WOUND_CLASS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the wound classification of the surgical wound at the time of principal operative procedure.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Clean


Clean/Contaminated


Contaminated


Dirty/Infected

columns.name: NSQIP_WOUND_CLOSE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the wound closure associated with the surgical wound at the time of principal operative procedure.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


All layers of incision (deep and superficial) fully closed


Only deep layers closed; superficial left open


No layers of incision are surgically closed

columns.name: NSQIP_ASA_CLASS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the ASA class associated with the case.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


ASA not assigned


ASA 1 - Normal/Healthy


ASA 2 - Mild systemic disease


ASA 3 - Severe systemic disease


ASA 4 - Life threat


ASA 5 - Moribund

columns.name: NSQIP_PROC_START_DTTM
columns.description: The time the principal operative procedure began.

columns.name: NSQIP_PROC_FINISH_DTTM
columns.description: The time the principal operative procedure was completed.

columns.name: NSQIP_LABS_ALL_UNKNOWN_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether all preop labs are unknown.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: NSQIP_HEIGHT
columns.description: The patient's height.

columns.name: NSQIP_HEIGHT_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the unit of the height entered in the height column.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Inches


Centimeters

columns.name: NSQIP_HEIGHT_UNKNOWN_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient's height is unknown.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_LABS_ALL_UNKNOWN_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_WEIGHT
columns.description: The patient's weight.

columns.name: NSQIP_WEIGHT_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the unit of the weight entered in the weight column.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Pounds


Kilograms

columns.name: NSQIP_WEIGHT_UNKNOWN_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient's weight is unknown.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_LABS_ALL_UNKNOWN_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_DIABETES_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the diabetes mellitus variable. It determines whether the patient had diabetes mellitus that required therapy with non-insulin agents or insulin.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Non-insulin


Insulin

columns.name: NSQIP_SMOKER_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient was a smoker within 12 months prior to surgery.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_DYSPNEA_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the dyspnea variable. It determines the usual and typical level of dyspnea.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Moderate exertion


At rest

columns.name: NSQIP_FHS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the Functional Health Status variable. It determines the best functional status of self-care as demonstrated by the patient prior to the onset of acute illness.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Independent


Partially dependent


Totally dependent


Unknown

columns.name: NSQIP_VENT_DEP_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient required ventilator-assisted respirations within 48 hours prior to the principal operative procedure.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_COPD_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient suffered from Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) prior to surgery.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_ASCITES_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient had fluid accumulation in the abodmen due to advanced liver disease or malignancy prior to surgery.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_CHF_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient had newly diagnosed Congestive Heart Failure (CHF) or a diagnosis of chronic CHF prior to surgery.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_HYPERTENSION_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient had hypertension that required medication prior to surgery.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_ARF_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient had renal compromise within 24 hours prior to surgery.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_DIALYSIS_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient required dialysis two weeks prior to surgery.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_CANCER_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient had advanced malignancy reflecting serious physiologic compromise.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_OPEN_WOUND_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient had an open wound prior to surgery.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_STEROID_USE_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient was receiving long-term pharmaceutical immunosuppresants.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_WEIGHT_LOSS_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient had 10% decrease in body weight in the six month interval prior to surgery.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_BLEEDING_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient was at an increased risk for bleeding prior to surgery due to a hematologic disorder or chronic anticoagulation.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_PREOP_TRANSFUSION_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient received a preop blood transfusion.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_SEPSIS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the sepsis variable. It determines the most significant level of sepsis prior to surgery.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Sepsis


None


Septic shock


SIRS

columns.name: NSQIP_WCN
columns.description: The Web Case Number (WCN) ID of the NSQIP case.

columns.name: NSQIP_FOLLOW_UP_30_DAYS_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the case was followed for the full 30 days.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_FOLLOW_UP_NUM_DAYS
columns.description: The number of days the case was followed. It is used only if the case was not followed for full 30 days.

columns.name: NSQIP_NUM_PHONE_ATTEMPTS
columns.description: The number of phone attempts that were done to follow the case. It is used only if the case was not followed for full 30 days.

columns.name: NSQIP_NUM_LETTER_ATTEMPTS
columns.description: The number of letter attempts that were done to follow the case. It is used only if the case was not followed for full 30 days.

columns.name: NSQIP_POST_OCCURRENCE_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the postoperative occurrence was present.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_DISCHG_DT
columns.description: The acute hospital discharge date.

columns.name: NSQIP_DISCHG_DEST_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the discharge destination.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Skilled care, not home


Unskilled facility, not home


Facility which was home


Home


Separate acute care


Unknown


Rehab


Expired


Multi-level senior community


Hospice


Against medical advice (AMA)


Home/Permanent residence


Acute care hospital


Other facility

columns.name: NSQIP_DISCHG_POSTOP_ICD9
columns.description: The ICD-9 code associated with the postoperative discharge.

columns.name: NSQIP_DISCHG_STILL_HOSP_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient was still in hospital 30 days after surgery.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_LABS_ALL_UNKNOWN_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_DISCHG_DEATH_LT_30_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the death occurred during operation or within 30 days of procedure.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_DISCHG_DEATH_GT_30_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the postoperative death occurred more than 30 days after procedure.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_DISCHG_DEATH_DT
columns.description: The date of death.

columns.name: NSQIP_DISCHG_DEATH_UNKWN_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the date of death is unknown.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_LABS_ALL_UNKNOWN_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_FST_REOP_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient returned to the OR within 30 days after principal procedure for the first reoperation.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_FST_REOP_DT
columns.description: The date the patient returned to the OR for the first reoperation.

columns.name: NSQIP_FST_REOP_DT_UNKWN_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the date of the first return to the OR is not known.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_LABS_ALL_UNKNOWN_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_FST_REOP_RELATED_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID of the value that indicates whether the first return to the OR was related to principal operative procedure.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No


Unknown

columns.name: NSQIP_SEC_REOP_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient returned to the OR within 30 days after principal procedure for the second reoperation.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_SEC_REOP_DT
columns.description: The date the patient returned to the OR for the second reoperation.

columns.name: NSQIP_SEC_REOP_DT_UNKWN_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the date of the second return to the OR is not known.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_LABS_ALL_UNKNOWN_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_SEC_REOP_RELATED_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID of the value that indicates whether the second return to the OR was related to principal operative procedure.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_FST_REOP_RELATED_C_NAME

columns.name: NSQIP_REOP_MORE_THAN_TWO_YN
columns.description:
Indicates if there were more than two unplanned returns to the OR.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN

columns.name: NSQIP_DISCHG_POSTOP_ICD10
columns.description: The ICD-10 code associated with the postoperative discharge.

columns.name: NSQIP_ENC_NUM
columns.description: The encounter number associated with the NSQIP case. It is an additional optional unique tracking number that hospitals can use for NSQIP cases.

columns.name: NSQIP_READMISSION_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient was readmitted. 'Y' indicates that the patient was readmitted. 'N' indicates that the patient was not readmitted.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NSQIP_EMERG_CASE_YN
